channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Michael Spavor: Canadian jailed for 11 years in China on spying charges
item.description: His sentencing is the latest development in a diplomatic spat between the two countries.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Biden says he does not regret troop withdrawal
item.description: The US president urges Afghan leaders to fight for their nation, as more cities fall to the Taliban.

item.title: Kinnaur: Two dead and dozens trapped in India landslide
item.description: Falling boulders have buried many vehicles, including a bus carrying 40 people, reports say.

item.title: China to ban karaoke songs with 'illegal content'
item.description: Songs that fall under this category include those that endanger national or territorial integrity.

item.title: Swiss embassy urges Chinese media to remove articles about scientist
item.description: A Swiss biologist who had been quoted in Chinese media in recent days did not exist, it said.

item.title: North Korea leaves hotline with South unanswered during military drills
item.description: Tensions have risen in the Korean peninsula as South Korea and the US hold joint military drills.

item.title: TikTok named as the most downloaded app of 2020
item.description: The Chinese app's popularity comes even after former President Donald Trump tried to ban it in the US.

item.title: China elephants: 150,000 evacuated from path of trekking herd
item.description: The herd is finally headed for home after an extraordinary 17-month migration in Yunnan province.

item.title: Malaysian singer dies of Covid days after giving birth
item.description: Siti Sarah Raisuddin never got to hold her newborn son, who was delivered via a three-hour surgery.

item.title: Jantar Mantar: India police arrest six over anti-Muslim rally
item.description: The arrests came after anti-Islamic slogans were raised at an event in Delhi on Sunday.

item.title: Anger as Nigerian diplomat manhandled in Indonesia
item.description: Nigeria says there was "no justification" for an official's mistreatment by immigration officers.

item.title: Climate change: The IPCC environmental warning India cannot ignore
item.description: It is the world's third largest carbon emitter, but hasn't set a date for becoming carbon neutral.

item.title: Why South Korean women are reclaiming their short hair
item.description: Thousands proudly show off their short hair after an Olympic athlete is criticised for her haircut.

item.title: 'Smallest baby at birth' home after 13 months in hospital
item.description: Kwek Yu Xuan weighed only 212g - the weight of an apple - when she was born in Singapore last year.

item.title: Why China's climate policy matters to us all
item.description: The global battle against climate change is likely to be won or lost in China.

item.title: Afghanistan: Why is there a war?
item.description: As foreign forces pull out after 20 years of war, what did it achieve and what happens next?

item.title: Johnson & Johnson: What we know about India's new Covid vaccines
item.description: India has approved Johnson & Johnson's single-dose vaccine as it ramps up production and procurement.

item.title: Assam-Mizoram clash: 'It was like a war between two countries'
item.description: A long-running border dispute is affecting relations between two neighbouring Indian states.
